comments:
It can be slow for large tasks, should possibly run in a job.  The following
sort of exception can occurr:

[2005-09-05, 15:0:49]  version: update@plugins/org.eclipse.ui.workbench_3.1.0.jar,
exception: org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.joinRun(ThreadJob.java:158)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:88)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:190)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:96)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1674)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1714)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1739)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.java.ui.LandmarkMarkerManager.landmarkAdded(LandmarkMarkerManager.java:97)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.java.ui.LandmarkMarkerManager.modelUpdated(LandmarkMarkerManager.java:63)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.java.ui.LandmarkMarkerManager.contextActivated(LandmarkMarkerManager.java:50)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.core.internal.MylarContextManager.contextActivated(MylarContextManager.java:267)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.MylarTasklistPlugin$1.taskActivated(MylarTasklistPlugin.java:161)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.TaskListManager.activateTask(TaskListManager.java:143)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.ui.actions.TaskActivateAction.run(TaskActivateAction.java:35)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.DefaultTaskListExternalizer.readTaskInfo(DefaultTaskListExternalizer.java:212)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.DefaultTaskListExternalizer.readTask(DefaultTaskListExternalizer.java:193)

FYI: It takes 8-10 seconds to activate a task on my Pentium 4 1.8 GHz laptop 
with 768 MB of RAM. The time is about the same for each of three tasks that 
have a relatively small context for Mylar bug fixes.

This is basically due to the totally bloated size of task contexts, an artefact
of the way the user study used to run.  The slowness probably comes from your
hard drive and not CPU.  On my 5400rpm drive I've never seen it that slow.  Next
week I'm going to implement a "collapse context" which should make the size of
taskscapes a couple of orders of magnitude smaller.
Collapsing has resulted in a 10-20x size reduction.
